Yui Tanagi

Calgary, Alberta · yui.tanagi@ucalgary.ca

I am currently a Master of Geographic Information Systems (MGIS) student at the University of Calgary focusing on Urban GIS. I hold an undergraduate degree (BSc) in Physical Geography and a graduate certificate in Geospatial Information Technology from the University of Calgary, which were obtained in June 2020 and December 2020, respectively.

I grew up living in three differrent countries; were Japan, China and Mexico and through my experiences of growing up as a Third Culture Kid (TCK) and being surrounded by different cultures, it has developed me into a unique and open-minded thinker with skills in adaptability, resilience, cross-cultural communicator, great problem-solving skills, great observational skills and global relationships (REWRITE).

I am skilled in ESRI ArcGIS Suite, Microsoft Office Suite, spatial data analysis, map production, and Python. I am an adaptable, forward-thinking, life-long learner who is seeking opportunities to contribute my GIS, analytical and problem-solving skills to an organization.

In this portfolio past courseworks of GIS, cartography, remote sensing, web mapping applications, and GIS programming will be included.

University of Calgary

    GIS Works

    Apart from being a web developer, I enjoy most of my time being outdoors. In the winter, I am an avid skier and novice ice climber. During the warmer months here in Colorado, I enjoy mountain biking, free climbing, and kayaking.
